entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 8:03AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WATER LEVELS FALLING ACROSS MATSU RIVERS AND STREAMS TODAY... Matanuska-Susitna Borough area rivers and streams have generally crested overnight or are near their crest this morning as of 7AM. High river levels will fall today with no additional rises expected in the short-term. For those continuing to recreate today, please take care to use

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Warm Temperatures through Sunday... Highest temperatures are expected today and possibly Saturday with temperatures warming into the upper 60s along the northern and central gulf coast and into the low 70s along the southern Gulf coast. A marine layer will continue to rebuild in the overnight hours along the coast through the weekend. This could

entry.summary: ...Warm Temperatures through Sunday... entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 08 at 2:04AM MDT until July 08 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 207, 290, 291, 292, 293, 295, 490, AND 491... * AFFECTED AREA...In Colorado, Fire Weather Zone 207 Southwest Colorado Lower Forecast Area, Fire Weather Zone 290 Paradox

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Richmond and central Westmoreland Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 230 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Montross, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, heavy rain, and frequent lightning.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued July 08 at 2:21PM EDT until July 08 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTH CENTRAL HANOVER AND NORTHWESTERN HENRICO COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF RICHMOND... At 221 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 2:18PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Henry, northeastern Patrick, and central Franklin Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 218 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Burnt Chimney to Fairy Stone State Park. Movement was east at 20 mph.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 2:14PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central King and Queen, northeastern New Kent and southeastern King William Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 214 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near King And Queen Court House, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 1:21PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Forest County through 145 PM CDT... At 121 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kentuck Lake Campground, or 15 miles east of Eagle River, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 12:24PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Sioux and southeastern Niobrara Counties through 100 PM MDT... HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail.
